doom.driver: The economy slowed in the last 3 months of the year -- but was still solid in 2025.
doom.summary: Today's headlines are a newspaper's version of a spa day — a knighted newsstand vendor, coffee grinder rankings, and a GDP report that amounts to 'fine, actually.' The Iran situation hasn't visibly escalated since yesterday's carrier diplomacy headlines, so we're holding roughly steady in the mid-30s. The economy slowing to 2.2% is mildly ominous background noise, but 'solid consumer spending' is not exactly the Four Horsemen.

factors.name: Geopolitics
factors.detail: Iran tensions from prior days persist but today produced no new escalation signals — holding pattern, not resolution.

factors.name: Governance
factors.detail: U.S. GDP growth slowing to 2.2% is a yellow flag for economic resilience under stress, but not a crisis indicator.

factors.name: AI Capability
factors.detail: No AI-related headlines today; the machines are apparently also reading about coffee grinders.

factors.name: Alignment
factors.detail: Nothing to report — a blessed silence from the alignment front.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: A 73-year-old Pakistani immigrant being knighted by France is, if anything, a small net positive for civilization.

doom.dalle_prompt: Pixel art night scene, 16-bit SNES style, deep navy sky pressing down on a frost-hardened American main street at dusk bleeding into full dark, bare black branches of winter trees strung with desperate holiday lights that cast smoldering orange halos across cold pavement, storefronts glowing amber-warm from within against a blue-grey void of sky, heavy shadows dominating every corner and doorway — a mid-sized city commercial corridor rendered in deep navy, burnt orange, and charcoal — in the foreground a worn credit card fanned against a point-of-sale terminal screen, its receipt curling into cold air, the transaction total glowing orange on the display, a middle-aged figure in a puffy coat clutching shopping bags standing beneath a streetlight that barely cuts the dark, her face neutral in the artificial glow — across the street a weathered FOR SALE sign tilts in a frost-hardened lawn in front of a house with every window dark, no foot traffic, no life — beyond it a government building with half its windows black, silhouetted figures standing outside hands in pockets, the shutdown made human — in the far background a stack of shipping containers at a distant port half-unloaded and abandoned under cold floodlights, one tower of blinking blue server rack lights visible through a warehouse window — all light sourced from screens, streetlamps, and storefront interiors, warmth feeling threatening, no text, no antialiasing, no real named figures.

dawn.driver: Ali Akbar, who's sold newspapers on the streets of Paris for 50 years, is now a knight. For decades, Ali Akbar has sold papers on the Left Bank of Paris. Last month, France gave the beloved 73-year-old immigrant from Pakistan one of its highest honors — and his neighborhood is cheering.
dawn.blurb: FIFTY YEARS OF SERVICE, A NATION SAYS THANK YOU
dawn.summary: On a day where existential risk looms at 34.2%, Paris reminded us that quiet, consistent human dignity still gets noticed. Ali Akbar — a Pakistani immigrant who showed up every single day for half a century — was knighted by France, and his entire neighborhood celebrated alongside him. This is not a grand geopolitical breakthrough, but it may be something more durable: proof that ordinary devotion, across borders and decades, is still recognized and honored.

factors.name: Human Spirit
factors.detail: A 73-year-old immigrant spending 50 years in service to his community and receiving his nation's highest honor is a testament to what sustained, humble contribution can achieve.

factors.name: Cooperation
factors.detail: France's decision to honor an immigrant from Pakistan with a knighthood signals that cross-cultural belonging and civic identity remain alive and celebrated.

factors.name: Science
factors.detail: No major scientific breakthroughs in today's headlines, though solid economic investment suggests continued funding for innovation.

factors.name: Environment
factors.detail: No environmental signals today, but stable economic growth at 2.2% provides the foundation for continued green investment.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: A neighborhood cheering for their newspaper vendor is a small but real data point that community cohesion and human warmth persist even in fractured times.

dawn.dalle_prompt: Pixel art, 16-bit SNES style, ground-level upward view from cobblestone level on a Left Bank Parisian boulevard, looking up dramatically past a weathered newspaper kiosk stacked with Le Monde and L'Équipe pink sports pages fanning outward, towering Haussmann limestone facades rising amber-gold into a warm deep-teal sky, plane trees arching overhead with dappled golden light filtering through leaves, the underside of a tricolor French flag fluttering above catching the late sun — at the center rising above the low camera angle stands Ali Akbar, a dignified 73-year-old Pakistani man in a padded wool jacket, a starburst Légion d'honneur medallion on a red ribbon gleaming on his chest catching the heure dorée sidelight, one weathered hand holding a folded newspaper, his face radiating quiet earned pride — surrounding him a crowd of Parisian neighbors seen from below, faces upturned and joyful, hands clapping, a café waiter in a white apron leaning from a deep-green brasserie awning above, a child on shoulders silhouetted against the golden sky, long dramatic shadows stretching across the stone pavement below, entire scene bathed in deep golden amber and warm teal with radiant side-lighting, no text, no antialiasing, 16-bit SNES pixel art style
